author: Dash_Justice
title: A blue dragster
review:
The Good:

  • Pull back motor adds some playability.
  • One of the few Racer themes to actually include minifigures.
  • Cool printed piece, and somewhat rare figure.

The Bad:

  • Pull back motor isn't as strong as newer ones.
  • Build is very minimal.
  • Build is also not very strong, but if you aren't going to play with it, it's not a problem.

The Verdict:

An average set that really only lacks in pieces.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Town (Race) - Speed Dragster Review
review:
This is a fun set to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

The instruction has 16 pages and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has some very cool blue and white parts which are always great to have for future MOC's (My own creations) and/or brickfilms for sure.

Minifigures

The minifig looks very cool as well. I love the printed shark on his torso and the design which LEGO has chosen for the face. The driver also has a blue helmet and black goggles.

The build

The build was very fun and easy and we also don't get any stickers to worry about.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6714-1.jpg[/img]


The dragster has a very cool design for sure. The engines sviwel and it also has a motor which you can pull back if you want to launch the vehicle. We also get a blue lever which can hold the dragster after you've pulled the motor back. This vehicle rolls very fast as well.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de
